page.title: 09Dorset & Salisbury Rlwy.
page.content:
then joined the original London to Bournemouth main line often refered to as Castlemans Corkscrew at West Moors.Passenger trains were the lines main traffic although a small amount of freight was also generated including that from the brickworks at Verwood and the pig marketing scheme at Downton.During WW2 a certain amount of military traffic used the line to and from the army camp at West Moors and up to Salisbury plain.
All passenger and goods trains were pulled by steam engines of varying sorts from the date the line opened until closure.At regular intervals along the track were platelayers and tool huts for the men who had to take care of the track.The station buildings along the line were a mixture of diffrent styles which
